Cvars.name: ai_debug_dyninteractions
Cvars.help: Debug the NPC dynamic interaction system.

Cvars.name: ai_frametime_limit
Cvars.help: frametime limit for min efficiency AIE_NORMAL (in sec's).

Cvars.name: sv_test_scripted_sequences
Cvars.help: Tests for scripted sequences that are embedded in the world. Run through your map with this set to check for NPCs falling through the world.

Cvars.name: ai_disable
Cvars.help: Bi-passes all AI logic routines and puts all NPCs into their idle animations.  Can be used to get NPCs out of your way and to test effect of AI logic routines on frame rate

Cvars.name: ai_setenabled
Cvars.help: Like ai_disable but you manually specify the state (with a 0 or 1) instead of toggling it.

Cvars.name: ai_show_hints
Cvars.help:
Displays all hints as small boxes
	Blue		- hint is available for use
	Red		- hint is currently being used by an NPC
	Orange		- hint not being used by timed out
	Grey		- hint has been disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_hull
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed hulls between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Arguments: 	-none-

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_jump
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_fly
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_crawl
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_grid
Cvars.help: Draw a grid on the floor where looking.

Cvars.name: ai_step
Cvars.help: NPCs will freeze after completing their current task.  To complete the next task, use 'ai_step' again.  To resume processing normally use 'ai_resume'

Cvars.name: ai_resume
Cvars.help: If NPC is stepping through tasks (see ai_step ) will resume normal processing.

Cvars.name: ai_next_hull
Cvars.help:
Cycles through the various hull sizes.  Currently selected hull size is written to the screen.  Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: ai_hull
Cvars.help:
Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	NPC name or classname, <none>=NPC under crosshair

Cvars.name: ai_nodes
Cvars.help:
Toggles node display.  First call displays the nodes for the given network as green objects.  Second call  displays the nodes and their IDs.  Nodes are color coded as follows:
	Green		- ground node
	Cyan		- air node
	Magenta	- climb node
	Grey		- node not available for selected hull size
	Orange 	- node currently locked

Cvars.name: ai_show_node
Cvars.help: Highlight the specified node

Cvars.name: ai_show_visibility
Cvars.help: Toggles visibility display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are visible from the selected node will be drawn in red with yellow lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not visible from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Cvars.name: ai_show_graph_connect
Cvars.help: Toggles graph connection display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are connected to the selected node by the net graph will be drawn in red with magenta lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not connected via the net graph from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Cvars.name: npc_bipass
Cvars.help:
Displays the local movement attempts by the given NPC(s) (triangulation detours).  Failed bypass routes are displayed in red, successful bypasses are shown in green.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at.

Cvars.name: npc_destroy
Cvars.help:
Removes the given NPC(s) from the universe
Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_kill
Cvars.help:
Kills the given NPC(s)
Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_enemies
Cvars.help:
Shows memory of NPC.  Draws an X on top of each memory.
	Eluded entities drawn in blue (don't know where it went)
	Unreachable entities drawn in green (can't get to it)
	Current enemy drawn in red
	Current target entity drawn in magenta
	All other entities drawn in pink
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_focus
Cvars.help:
Displays red line to NPC's enemy (if has one) and blue line to NPC's target entity (if has one)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_create
Cvars.help:
Creates an NPC of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location).  
	Arguments:	[npc_class_name] [name of npc (optional) ] [addon type (optional) ] [name of addon (optional) ]

Cvars.name: npc_create_aimed
Cvars.help:
Creates an NPC aimed away from the player of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location).  Note that this only works for npc classes that are already in the world.  You can not create an entity that doesn't have an instance in the level.
	Arguments:	{npc_class_name}

Cvars.name: npc_destroy_unselected
Cvars.help: Removes all NPCs from the universe that aren't currently selected

Cvars.name: npc_freeze
Cvars.help:
Selected NPC(s) will freeze in place (or unfreeze). If there are no selected NPCs, uses the NPC under the crosshair.
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_set_freeze
Cvars.help:
Selected NPC(s) will freeze in place (or unfreeze). If there are no selected NPCs, uses the NPC under the crosshair.
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_freeze_unselected
Cvars.help: Freeze all NPCs not selected

Cvars.name: npc_set_freeze_unselected
Cvars.help: Freeze all NPCs not selected

Cvars.name: npc_thinknow
Cvars.help: Trigger NPC to think

Cvars.name: npc_teleport
Cvars.help:
Selected NPC will teleport to the location that the player is looking (shown with a purple box)
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_go_do_run
Cvars.help: Set whether should run on NPC go

Cvars.name: npc_go
Cvars.help:
Selected NPC(s) will go to the location that the player is looking (shown with a purple box)
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_go_random
Cvars.help:
Sends all selected NPC(s) to a random node.
	Arguments:   	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_reset
Cvars.help:
Reloads schedules for all NPC's from their script files
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_nearest
Cvars.help:
Draw's a while box around the NPC(s) nearest node
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_route
Cvars.help:
Displays the current route of the given NPC as a line on the screen.  Waypoints along the route are drawn as small cyan rectangles.  Line is color coded in the following manner:
	Blue	- path to a node
	Cyan	- detour around an object (triangulation)
	Red	- jump
	Maroon - path to final target position
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_select
Cvars.help:
Select or deselects the given NPC(s) for later manipulation.  Selected NPC's are shown surrounded by a red translucent box
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_combat
Cvars.help:
Displays text debugging information about the squad and enemy of the selected NPC  (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_squads
Cvars.help: Obsolete.  Replaced by npc_combat

Cvars.name: npc_tasks
Cvars.help:
Displays detailed text debugging information about the all the tasks of the selected NPC current schedule (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_task_text
Cvars.help:
Outputs text debugging information to the console about the all the tasks + break conditions of the selected NPC current schedule
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_conditions
Cvars.help:
Displays all the current AI conditions that an NPC has in the overlay text.
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_viewcone
Cvars.help:
Displays the viewcone of the NPC (where they are currently looking and what the extents of there vision is)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_relationships
Cvars.help:
Displays the relationships between this NPC and all others.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_steering
Cvars.help:
Displays the steering obstructions of the NPC (used to perform local avoidance)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_steering_all
Cvars.help: Displays the steering obstructions of all NPCs (used to perform local avoidance)

Cvars.name: npc_heal
Cvars.help: Heals the target back to full health

Cvars.name: npc_ammo_deplete
Cvars.help: Subtracts half of the target's ammo

Cvars.name: ai_clear_bad_links
Cvars.help: Clears bits set on nav links indicating link is unusable

Cvars.name: ai_test_los
Cvars.help: Test AI LOS from the player's POV

Cvars.name: ainet_generate_report
Cvars.help: Generate a report to the console.

Cvars.name: ainet_generate_report_only
Cvars.help: Generate a report to the console.

Cvars.name: chet_debug_idle
Cvars.help: If set one, many debug prints to help track down the TLK_IDLE issue. Set two for super verbose info

Cvars.name: rr_forceconcept
Cvars.help:
fire a response concept directly at a given character.
USAGE: rr_forceconcept <target> <concept> "criteria1:value1,criteria2:value2,..."
criteria values are optional.

Cvars.name: ai_drop_hint
Cvars.help: Drop an ai_hint at the player's current eye position.

Cvars.name: ai_set_move_height_epsilon
Cvars.help: Set how high AI bumps up ground walkers when checking steps

Cvars.name: ai_nav_debug_experimental_pathing
Cvars.help: Draw paths tried during search for bodysnatcher pathing

Cvars.name: ai_debug_node_connect
Cvars.help: Debug the attempted connection between two nodes

Cvars.name: g_ai_threadedgraphbuild
Cvars.help: If true, use experimental threaded node graph building.

Cvars.name: sk_ally_regen_time
Cvars.help: Time taken for an ally to regenerate a point of health.

Cvars.name: sv_npc_talker_maxdist
Cvars.help: NPCs over this distance from the player won't attempt to speak.

Cvars.name: rr_debug_qa
Cvars.help: Set to 1 to see debug related to the Question & Answer system used to create conversations between allied NPCs.

Cvars.name: rr_reloadresponsesystems
Cvars.help: Reload all response system scripts.

Cvars.name: rr_followup_maxdist
Cvars.help: 'then ANY' or 'then ALL' response followups will be dispatched only to characters within this distance.

Cvars.name: rr_thenany_score_slop
Cvars.help: When computing respondents for a 'THEN ANY' rule, all rule-matching scores within this much of the best score will be considered.

Cvars.name: sv_showanimstate
Cvars.help: Show the (server) animation state for the specified entity (-1 for none).

Cvars.name: sv_showanimstate_log
Cvars.help: 1 to output sv_showanimstate to Msg(). 2 to store in AnimStateServer.log. 3 for both.

Cvars.name: sv_showanimstate_activities
Cvars.help: Show activities in the (server) animation state display.

Cvars.name: npc_height_adjust
Cvars.help: Enable test mode for ik height adjustment

Cvars.name: sv_pvsskipanimation
Cvars.help: Skips SetupBones when npc's are outside the PVS

Cvars.name: ai_setupbones_debug
Cvars.help: Shows that bones that are setup every think

Cvars.name: sv_netvisdist
Cvars.help: Test networking visibility distance

Cvars.name: ent_show_contexts
Cvars.help: Show entity contexts in ent_text display

Cvars.name: ai_debug_los
Cvars.help: NPC Line-Of-Sight debug mode. If 1, solid entities that block NPC LOC will be highlighted with white bounding boxes. If 2, it'll show non-solid entities that would do it if they were solid.

Cvars.name: ent_messages_draw
Cvars.help: Visualizes all entity input/output activity.

Cvars.name: ent_text
Cvars.help:
Displays text debugging information about the given entity(ies) on top of the entity (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_script_dump
Cvars.help:
Dumps the names and values of this entity's script scope to the console
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_bbox
Cvars.help:
Displays the movement bounding box for the given entity(ies) in orange.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_absbox
Cvars.help:
Displays the total bounding box for the given entity(s) in green.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_rbox
Cvars.help:
Displays the total bounding box for the given entity(s) in green.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_attachments
Cvars.help:
Displays the attachment points on an entity.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_viewoffset
Cvars.help:
Displays the eye position for the given entity(ies) in red.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_remove
Cvars.help:
Removes the given entity(s)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_remove_all
Cvars.help:
Removes all entities of the specified type
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name}

Cvars.name: ent_setname
Cvars.help:
Sets the targetname of the given entity(s)
	Arguments:   	{new entity name} {entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: find_ent
Cvars.help:
Find and list all entities with classnames or targetnames that contain the specified substring.
Format: find_ent <substring>

Cvars.name: find_ent_index
Cvars.help:
Display data for entity matching specified index.
Format: find_ent_index <index>

Cvars.name: ent_dump
Cvars.help:
Usage:
   ent_dump <entity name>

Cvars.name: ent_fire
Cvars.help:
Usage:
   ent_fire <target> [action] [value] [delay]

Cvars.name: ent_cancelpendingentfires
Cvars.help: Cancels all ent_fire created outputs that are currently waiting for their delay to expire.

Cvars.name: ent_info
Cvars.help:
Usage:
   ent_info <class name>

Cvars.name: ent_messages
Cvars.help:
Toggles input/output message display for the selected entity(ies).  The name of the entity will be displayed as well as any messages that it sends or receives.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_pause
Cvars.help: Toggles pausing of input/output message processing for entities.  When turned on processing of all message will stop.  Any messages displayed with 'ent_messages' will stop fading and be displayed indefinitely. To step through the messages one by one use 'ent_step'.

Cvars.name: picker
Cvars.help:
Toggles 'picker' mode.  When picker is on, the bounding box, pivot and debugging text is displayed for whatever entity the player is looking at.
	Arguments:	full - enables all debug information

Cvars.name: ent_pivot
Cvars.help:
Displays the pivot for the given entity(ies).
	(y=up=green, z=forward=blue, x=left=red). 
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_step
Cvars.help: When 'ent_pause' is set this will step through one waiting input / output message at a time.

Cvars.name: ent_show_response_criteria
Cvars.help:
Print, to the console, an entity's current criteria set used to select responses.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_autoaim
Cvars.help:
Displays the entity's autoaim radius.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_create
Cvars.help: Creates an entity of the given type where the player is looking.

Cvars.name: ent_teleport
Cvars.help:
Teleport the specified entity to where the player is looking.
	Format: ent_teleport <entity name>

Cvars.name: ent_orient
Cvars.help:
Orient the specified entity to match the player's angles. By default, only orients target entity's YAW. Use the 'allangles' option to orient on all axis.
	Format: ent_orient <entity name> <optional: allangles>

Cvars.name: scene_showlook
Cvars.help: When playing back, show the directions of look events.

Cvars.name: scene_showmoveto
Cvars.help: When moving, show the end location.

Cvars.name: scene_showunlock
Cvars.help: Show when a vcd is playing but normal AI is running.

Cvars.name: ai_expression_optimization
Cvars.help: Disable npc background expressions when you can't see them.

Cvars.name: ai_expression_frametime
Cvars.help: Maximum frametime to still play background expressions.

Cvars.name: sv_allchat
Cvars.help: Players can receive all other players' text chat, team restrictions apply

Cvars.name: dumpeventqueue
Cvars.help: Dump the contents of the Entity I/O event queue to the console.

Cvars.name: tv_relaytextchat
Cvars.help: Relay text chat data: 0=off, 1=say, 2=say+say_team

Cvars.name: cast_ray
Cvars.help: Tests collision detection

Cvars.name: cast_hull
Cvars.help: Tests hull collision detection

Cvars.name: drawline
Cvars.help:
Draws line between two 3D Points.
	Green if no collision
	Red is collides with something
	Arguments: x1 y1 z1 x2 y2 z2

Cvars.name: drawcross
Cvars.help:
Draws a cross at the given location
	Arguments: x y z

Cvars.name: kill
Cvars.help: Kills the player with generic damage

Cvars.name: explode
Cvars.help: Kills the player with explosive damage

Cvars.name: killvector
Cvars.help: Kills a player applying force. Usage: killvector <player> <x value> <y value> <z value>

Cvars.name: explodevector
Cvars.help: Kills a player applying an explosive force. Usage: explodevector <player> <x value> <y value> <z value>

Cvars.name: buddha
Cvars.help: Toggle.  Player takes damage but won't die. (Shows red cross when health is zero)

Cvars.name: say
Cvars.help: Display player message

Cvars.name: say_team
Cvars.help: Display player message to team

Cvars.name: give
Cvars.help:
Give item to player.
	Arguments: <item_name>

Cvars.name: setmodel
Cvars.help: Changes's player's model

Cvars.name: test_dispatcheffect
Cvars.help:
Test a clientside dispatch effect.
	Usage: test_dispatcheffect <effect name> <distance away> <flags> <magnitude> <scale>
	Defaults are: <distance 1024> <flags 0> <magnitude 0> <scale 0>

Cvars.name: use
Cvars.help:
Use a particular weapon	
Arguments: <weapon_name>

Cvars.name: noclip
Cvars.help: Toggle. Player becomes non-solid and flies.  Optional argument of 0 or 1 to force enable/disable

Cvars.name: god
Cvars.help: Toggle. Player becomes invulnerable.

Cvars.name: gods
Cvars.help: Toggle. All players become invulnerable.

Cvars.name: ent_setpos
Cvars.help: Move entity to position

Cvars.name: ent_setang
Cvars.help: Set entity angles

Cvars.name: setpos
Cvars.help: Move player to specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: setpos_player
Cvars.help: Move specified player to specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: setang
Cvars.help: Snap player eyes to specified pitch yaw <roll:optional> (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: setpos_exact
Cvars.help: Move player to an exact specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: setang_exact
Cvars.help: Snap player eyes and orientation to specified pitch yaw <roll:optional> (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: notarget
Cvars.help: Toggle. Player becomes hidden to NPCs.

Cvars.name: hurtme
Cvars.help:
Hurts the player.
	Arguments: <health to lose>

Cvars.name: parachute
Cvars.help: equips parachute

Cvars.name: exojump
Cvars.help: equips or removes exojump

Cvars.name: player_ping
Cvars.help: Creates a ping notification where the player is looking.

Cvars.name: groundlist
Cvars.help: Display ground entity list <index>

Cvars.name: commentary_available
Cvars.help: Automatically set by the game when a commentary file is available for the current map.

Cvars.name: commentary
Cvars.help: Desired commentary mode state.

Cvars.name: survival_check_num_possible_final_zone
Cvars.help: print out a number of all possible final zone

Cvars.name: test_entity_blocker
Cvars.help: Test command that drops an entity blocker out in front of the player.

Cvars.name: respawn_entities
Cvars.help: Respawn all the entities in the map.

Cvars.name: report_entities
Cvars.help: Lists all entities

Cvars.name: report_touchlinks
Cvars.help: Lists all touchlinks

Cvars.name: report_simthinklist
Cvars.help: Lists all simulating/thinking entities

Cvars.name: cl_csm_server_status
Cvars.help:
Usage:
 cl_csm_server_status

Cvars.name: dbghist_addline
Cvars.help: Add a line to the debug history. Format: <category id> <line>

Cvars.name: dbghist_dump
Cvars.help:
Dump the debug history to the console. Format: <category id>
    Categories:
     0: Entity I/O
     1: AI Decisions
     2: Scene Print
     3: Alyx Blind
     4: Log of damage done to player

Cvars.name: fadeout
Cvars.help: fadeout {time r g b}: Fades the screen to black or to the specified color over the given number of seconds.

Cvars.name: fadein
Cvars.help: fadein {time r g b}: Fades the screen in from black or from the specified color over the given number of seconds.

Cvars.name: shake
Cvars.help: Shake the screen.

Cvars.name: fx_new_sparks
Cvars.help: Use new style sparks.

Cvars.name: fish_dormant
Cvars.help: Turns off interactive fish behavior. Fish become immobile and unresponsive.

Cvars.name: fog_volume_debug
Cvars.help: If enabled, prints diagnostic information about the current fog volume

Cvars.name: foundry_update_entity
Cvars.help: Updates the entity's position/angles when in edit mode

Cvars.name: foundry_sync_hammer_view
Cvars.help: Move Hammer's 3D view to the same position as the engine's 3D view.

Cvars.name: foundry_engine_get_mouse_control
Cvars.help: Give the engine control of the mouse.

Cvars.name: foundry_engine_release_mouse_control
Cvars.help: Give the control of the mouse back to Hammer.

Cvars.name: foundry_select_entity
Cvars.help: Select the entity under the crosshair or select entities with the specified name.

Cvars.name: sv_showladders
Cvars.help: Show bbox and dismount points for all ladders (must be set before level load.)

Cvars.name: mapcyclefile
Cvars.help: Name of the .txt file used to cycle the maps on multiplayer servers

Cvars.name: occlusion_test_shadow_length
Cvars.help: Max length of completely occluded shadow to consider a player for occlusion test. If shadow provably stops at this distance, the player may be considered for occlusion test. For longer shadows, we just don't do occlusion because we are not likely to find full occlusion when one of the boxes is expanded too much.

Cvars.name: occlusion_test_camera_margins
Cvars.help: Amount by which the camera (viewer's eye) is expanded for occlusion test. This should be large enough to accommodate eye's movement within a frame or two

Cvars.name: pvs_min_player_distance
Cvars.help: Min distance to player at which PVS is used. At closer distances, PVS assumes we can see a shadow or something else from the player, so it's safer to just always be "Visible"

Cvars.name: sv_force_transmit_ents
Cvars.help: Will transmit all entities to client, regardless of PVS conditions (will still skip based on transmit flags, however).

Cvars.name: sv_comp_mode_allow_dc
Cvars.help: Set this to 1 to allow direct connects in Competitive mode

Cvars.name: sv_dc_friends_reqd
Cvars.help: Set this to 0 to allow direct connects to a game in progress even if no presents are present

Cvars.name: motdfile
Cvars.help: The MOTD file to load.

Cvars.name: hostfile

Cvars.name: bot_quota_mode

Determines the type of quota.
Allowed values: 'normal', 'fill', and 'match'.
If 'fill', the server will adjust bots to keep N players in the game, where N is bot_quota.
If 'match', the server will maintain a 1:N ratio of humans to bots, where N is bot_quota.

This string is prefixed to the name of all bots that join the game.
<difficulty> will be replaced with the bot's difficulty.
<weaponclass> will be replaced with the bot's desired weapon class.
<skill> will be replaced with a 0-100 representation of the bot's skill.

Cvars.name: nav_edit
Cvars.help: Set to one to interactively edit the Navigation Mesh. Set to zero to leave edit mode.

Cvars.help: Show current 'danger' levels.

Cvars.help: Stop continuously adding to the selected set.

Cvars.help: Stop dragging a selection area.

Cvars.name: nav_begin_drag_deselecting

Cvars.help: Start continuously removing from the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_end_deselecting
Cvars.help: Stop continuously removing from the selected set.

Cvars.help: Start or stop continuously removing from the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_end_shift_xy
Cvars.help: Finish shifting the Selected Set.

Cvars.help: Adds all obstructed areas to the selected set

Cvars.name: nav_split
Cvars.help: To split an Area into two, align the split line using your cursor and invoke the split command.

Cvars.name: nav_make_sniper_spots
Cvars.help: Chops the marked area into disconnected sub-areas suitable for sniper spots.

Cvars.name: nav_merge
Cvars.help: To merge two Areas into one, mark the first Area, highlight the second by pointing your cursor at it, and invoke the merge command.

Cvars.name: nav_mark
Cvars.help: Marks the Area or Ladder under the cursor for manipulation by subsequent editing commands.

Cvars.name: nav_unmark
Cvars.help: Clears the marked Area or Ladder.

Cvars.name: nav_begin_area
Cvars.help: Defines a corner of a new Area or Ladder. To complete the Area or Ladder, drag the opposite corner to the desired location and issue a 'nav_end_area' command.

Cvars.name: nav_end_area
Cvars.help: Defines the second corner of a new Area or Ladder and creates it.

Cvars.name: nav_connect
Cvars.help: To connect two Areas, mark the first Area, highlight the second Area, then invoke the connect command. Note that this creates a ONE-WAY connection from the first to the second Area. To make a two-way connection, also connect the second area to the first.

Cvars.name: nav_disconnect
Cvars.help: To disconnect two Areas, mark an Area, highlight a second Area, then invoke the disconnect command. This will remove all connections between the two Areas.

Cvars.name: nav_splice
Cvars.help: To splice, mark an area, highlight a second area, then invoke the splice command to create a new, connected area between them.

Cvars.name: nav_crouch
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'must crouch in this area' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_precise
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'dont avoid obstacles' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_jump
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'traverse this area by jumping' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_no_jump
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'dont jump in this area' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_stop
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'must stop when entering this area' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_walk
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'traverse this area by walking' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_run
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'traverse this area by running' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_avoid
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'avoid this area when possible' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_transient
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'area is transient and may become blocked' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_dont_hide
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'area is not suitable for hiding spots' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_stand
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'stand while hiding' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_no_hostages
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'hostages cannot use this area' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_strip
Cvars.help: Strips all Hiding Spots, Approach Points, and Encounter Spots from the current Area.

Cvars.name: nav_save
Cvars.help: Saves the current Navigation Mesh to disk.

Cvars.name: nav_load
Cvars.help: Loads the Navigation Mesh for the current map.

Cvars.name: nav_use_place
Cvars.help: If used without arguments, all available Places will be listed. If a Place argument is given, the current Place is set.

Cvars.name: nav_place_replace
Cvars.help: Replaces all instances of the first place with the second place.

Cvars.name: nav_place_list
Cvars.help: Lists all place names used in the map.

Cvars.name: nav_toggle_place_mode
Cvars.help: Toggle the editor into and out of Place mode. Place mode allows labelling of Area with Place names.

Cvars.name: nav_set_place_mode
Cvars.help: Sets the editor into or out of Place mode. Place mode allows labelling of Area with Place names.

Cvars.name: nav_place_floodfill
Cvars.help: Sets the Place of the Area under the cursor to the curent Place, and 'flood-fills' the Place to all adjacent Areas. Flood-filling stops when it hits an Area with the same Place, or a different Place than that of the initial Area.

Cvars.name: nav_place_set
Cvars.help: Sets the Place of all selected areas to the current Place.

Cvars.name: nav_place_pick
Cvars.help: Sets the current Place to the Place of the Area under the cursor.

Cvars.name: nav_toggle_place_painting
Cvars.help: Toggles Place Painting mode. When Place Painting, pointing at an Area will 'paint' it with the current Place.

Cvars.name: nav_mark_unnamed
Cvars.help: Mark an Area with no Place name. Useful for finding stray areas missed when Place Painting.

Cvars.name: nav_corner_select
Cvars.help: Select a corner of the currently marked Area. Use multiple times to access all four corners.

Cvars.name: nav_corner_raise
Cvars.help: Raise the selected corner of the currently marked Area.

Cvars.name: nav_corner_lower
Cvars.help: Lower the selected corner of the currently marked Area.

Cvars.name: nav_corner_place_on_ground
Cvars.help: Places the selected corner of the currently marked Area on the ground.

Cvars.name: nav_warp_to_mark
Cvars.help: Warps the player to the marked area.

Cvars.name: nav_ladder_flip
Cvars.help: Flips the selected ladder's direction.

Cvars.name: nav_generate
Cvars.help: Generate a Navigation Mesh for the current map and save it to disk.

Cvars.name: nav_generate_incremental
Cvars.help: Generate a Navigation Mesh for the current map and save it to disk.

Cvars.name: nav_analyze
Cvars.help: Re-analyze the current Navigation Mesh and save it to disk.

Cvars.name: nav_analyze_scripted
Cvars.help: commandline hook to run a nav_analyze and then quit.

Cvars.name: nav_mark_walkable
Cvars.help: Mark the current location as a walkable position. These positions are used as seed locations when sampling the map to generate a Navigation Mesh.

Cvars.name: nav_clear_walkable_marks
Cvars.help: Erase any previously placed walkable positions.

Cvars.name: nav_compress_id
Cvars.help: Re-orders area and ladder ID's so they are continuous.

Cvars.name: nav_build_ladder
Cvars.help: Attempts to build a nav ladder on the climbable surface under the cursor.

Cvars.name: wipe_nav_attributes
Cvars.help: Clear all nav attributes of selected area.

Cvars.name: nav_clear_attribute
Cvars.help: Remove given nav attribute from all areas in the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_mark_attribute
Cvars.help: Set nav attribute for all areas in the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_chop_selected
Cvars.help: Chops all selected areas into their component 1x1 areas

Cvars.name: nav_simplify_selected
Cvars.help: Chops all selected areas into their component 1x1 areas and re-merges them together into larger areas

Cvars.name: ent_keyvalue
Cvars.help:
Applies the comma delimited key=value pairs to the entity with the given Hammer ID.
	Format: ent_keyvalue <entity id> <key1>=<value1>,<key2>=<value2>,...,<keyN>=<valueN>

Comma delimited list of ip:port of servers used to search for dedicated servers instead of searching for public servers.
Use syntax `publicip1:port|privateip1:port,publicip2:port|privateip2:port` if your server is behind NAT.
If the server is behind NAT, you can specify `0.0.0.0|privateip:port` and if server port is in the list of `mm_server_search_lan_ports` its public address should be automatically detected.

Cvars.name: m_customaccel
Cvars.help:
Custom mouse acceleration:
0: custom accelaration disabled
1: mouse_acceleration = min(m_customaccel_max, pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent) * m_customaccel_scale + sensitivity)
2: Same as 1, with but x and y sensitivity are scaled by m_pitch and m_yaw respectively.
3: mouse_acceleration = pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent - 1) * sensitivity

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_C
Cvars.help: Does not affect PS3 which uses FXAA_CONSOLE_PS3_EDGE_THRESHOLD define due to being ALU bound (and only safe values are 1/4, 1/8). On X360, (0.125 - default, leaves less aliasing, but is softer, 0.25 - leaves more aliasing and is sharper)

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_min_C
Cvars.help: Trims the algorithm from processing darks. Does not affect PS3 due to being ALU bound. (0.04 - slower and less aliasing in darks, 0.05 - default, 0.06 - faster but more aliasing in darks). Special note: when using FXAA_GREEN_AS_LUMA likely want to set this to zero

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_subpixel_Q
Cvars.help: Effects sub-pixel AA quality and inversely sharpness (only used on FXAA Quality): (0.0 - off), (1.0 - upper limit, softer), default = 0.75

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_Q
Cvars.help: The minimum amount of local contrast required to apply algorithm: (0.063 - overkill, slower), (0.125 - high quality), (0.166 - default), (0.250 - low quality), (0.333 - too little, faster)

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_min_Q
Cvars.help: Trims the algorithm from processing darks: (0.0312 - visible limit, slower), (0.0625 - high quality, faster), (0.0833 - upper limit, the start of fisible unfiltered edges). Special note: when using FXAA_GREEN_AS_LUMA, likely want to set this to zero

Cvars.name: cl_blurClearAlpha

Cvars.name: r_ignoreStaticColorChecksum
Cvars.help: 0 - validate vhvhdr and studiohdr checksum, 1 - default, ignore checksum (useful if iterating physics model only for example)

Cvars.name: r_ambientboost
Cvars.help: Set to boost ambient term if it is totally swamped by local lights

Cvars.name: r_ambientmin
Cvars.help: Threshold above which ambient cube will not boost (i.e. it's already sufficiently bright

Cvars.name: r_ambientfraction
Cvars.help: Fraction of direct lighting used to boost lighting when model requests

Cvars.name: r_ambientfactor
Cvars.help: Boost ambient cube by no more than this factor

Cvars.name: r_modelAmbientMin
Cvars.help: Minimum value for the ambient lighting on dynamic models with more than one bone (like players and their guns).

Cvars.name: r_drawmodelstatsoverlaymin
Cvars.help: time in milliseconds that a model must take to render before showing an overlay in r_drawmodelstatsoverlay 2

Cvars.name: r_drawmodelstatsoverlaymax
Cvars.help: time in milliseconds beyond which a model overlay is fully red in r_drawmodelstatsoverlay 2

Cvars.name: r_drawbrushmodels
Cvars.help: Render brush models. 0=Off, 1=Normal, 2=Wireframe

Cvars.name: mat_resolveFullFrameDepth
Cvars.help: Enable depth resolve to a texture. 0=disable, 1=enable via resolve tricks if supported in hw, otherwise disable, 2=force extra depth only pass

Cvars.name: mat_configcurrent
Cvars.help: show the current video control panel config for the material system

Cvars.name: mat_setvideomode
Cvars.help: sets the width, height, windowed state of the material system

Cvars.name: mat_savechanges
Cvars.help: saves current video configuration to the registry

Cvars.name: mat_updateconvars
Cvars.help: updates the video config convars

Cvars.name: mat_debug
Cvars.help: Activates debugging spew for a specific material.

Cvars.name: mat_suppress
Cvars.help: Suppress a material from drawing

Cvars.name: mat_info
Cvars.help: Shows material system info

Cvars.name: mod_touchalldata
Cvars.help: Touch model data during level startup

Cvars.name: mod_forcetouchdata
Cvars.help: Forces all model file data into cache on model load.

Cvars.name: mem_vcollide
Cvars.help: Dumps the memory used by vcollides

Cvars.name: mod_DumpWeaponWiewModelCache
Cvars.help: Dumps the weapon view model cache contents

Cvars.name: mod_DumpWeaponWorldModelCache
Cvars.help: Dumps the weapon world model cache contents

Cvars.name: vx_model_list
Cvars.help: Dump models to VXConsole

Cvars.name: mod_dynamicmodeldebug
Cvars.help: debug spew for dynamic model loading

Cvars.name: mod_combiner_info
Cvars.help: debug spew for Combiner Info

Cvars.name: r_visocclusion
Cvars.help: Activate/deactivate wireframe rendering of what the occlusion system is doing.

Cvars.name: r_occlusion
Cvars.help: Activate/deactivate the occlusion system.

Cvars.name: r_occludermincount
Cvars.help: At least this many occluders will be used, no matter how big they are.

Cvars.name: r_occlusionspew
Cvars.help: Activate/deactivates spew about what the occlusion system is doing.

Cvars.name: r_occluderminarea
Cvars.help: Prevents this occluder from being used if it takes up less than X% of the screen. 0 means use whatever the level said to use.

Cvars.name: r_occludeemaxarea
Cvars.help: Prevents occlusion testing for entities that take up more than X% of the screen. 0 means use whatever the level said to use.

Cvars.name: r_portalsopenall
Cvars.help: Open all portals

Cvars.name: r_drawdecals
Cvars.help: Render decals.

Cvars.name: r_drawbatchdecals
Cvars.help: Render decals batched.

Cvars.name: sv_dump_serialized_entities_mem
Cvars.help: Dump serialized entity allocations stats.

Cvars.name: sv_reliableavatardata
Cvars.help: When enabled player avatars are exchanged via gameserver (0: off, 1: players, 2: server)

Cvars.name: sv_duplicate_playernames_ok
Cvars.help: When enabled player names won't have the (#) in front of their names its the same as another player.

Cvars.name: sv_signon_dos_disconnect
Cvars.help: Number of extra signon state confirmations required to disconnect a misbehaving client.

Cvars.name: sv_timeout
Cvars.help: After this many seconds without a message from a client, the client is dropped

Cvars.name: sv_maxrate
Cvars.help: Max bandwidth rate allowed on server, 0 == unlimited

Cvars.name: sv_minrate
Cvars.help: Min bandwidth rate allowed on server, 0 == unlimited

Cvars.name: sv_maxupdaterate
Cvars.help: Maximum updates per second that the server will allow

Cvars.name: sv_minupdaterate
Cvars.help: Minimum updates per second that the server will allow

Cvars.name: sv_stressbots
Cvars.help: If set to 1, the server calculates data and fills packets to bots. Used for perf testing.

Cvars.name: sv_replaybots
Cvars.help: If set to 1, the server records data needed to replay network stream from bot's perspective

Cvars.name: sv_allowdownload
Cvars.help: Allow clients to download files

Cvars.name: sv_allowupload
Cvars.help: Allow clients to upload customizations files

Cvars.name: sv_sendtables
Cvars.help: Force full sendtable sending path.

Cvars.name: spec_replay_enable
Cvars.help: Enable Killer Replay, requires hltv server running (0:off, 1:default, 2:force)

Cvars.name: spec_replay_message_time
Cvars.help: How long to show the message about Killer Replay after death. The best setting is a bit shorter than spec_replay_autostart_delay + spec_replay_leadup_time + spec_replay_winddown_time

Cvars.name: spec_replay_rate_limit
Cvars.help: Minimum allowable pause between replay requests in seconds

Cvars.name: ss_voice_hearpartner
Cvars.help: Route voice between splitscreen players on same system.

Cvars.name: sv_max_dropped_packets_to_process
Cvars.help: Max dropped packets to process. Lower settings prevent lagged players from simulating too far in the past. Setting of 0 disables cap.

Cvars.name: cl_allowdownload
Cvars.help: Client downloads customization files

Cvars.name: sv_quota_stringcmdspersecond
Cvars.help: How many string commands per second clients are allowed to submit, 0 to disallow all string commands

Cvars.name: sv_allow_legacy_cmd_execution_from_client
Cvars.help: Enables old concommand execution behavior allowing remote clients to run any command not explicitly flagged as disallowed.

Cvars.name: spec_replay_on_death
Cvars.help: When > 0, sets the mode whereas players see delayed replay, and are segregated into a domain of chat and voice separate from the alive players

Cvars.name: sv_extra_client_connect_time
Cvars.help: Seconds after client connect during which extra frames are buffered to prevent non-delta'd update

Cvars.name: spec_replay_rate_base
Cvars.help: Base time scale of Killer Replay.Experimental.

Cvars.name: sv_deltatime
Cvars.help: Enable profiling of CalcDelta calls

Cvars.name: sv_deltaprint
Cvars.help: Print accumulated CalcDelta profiling data (only if sv_deltatime is on)

Cvars.name: sv_show_cull_props
Cvars.help: Print out props that are being culled/added by recipent proxies.

Cvars.name: sv_delta_entity_full_buffer_size
Cvars.help: Buffer size for delta entities

Cvars.name: sv_filterban
Cvars.help: Set packet filtering by IP mode

Cvars.name: addip
Cvars.help: Add an IP address to the ban list.

Cvars.name: banip
Cvars.help: Add an IP address to the ban list.

Cvars.name: removeip
Cvars.help: Remove an IP address from the ban list.

Cvars.name: listip
Cvars.help: List IP addresses on the ban list.

Cvars.name: writeip
Cvars.help: Save the ban list to banned_ip.cfg.

Cvars.name: writeid
Cvars.help: Writes a list of permanently-banned user IDs to banned_user.cfg.

Cvars.name: removeallids
Cvars.help: Remove all user IDs from the ban list.

Cvars.name: removeid
Cvars.help: Remove a user ID from the ban list.

Cvars.name: listid
Cvars.help: Lists banned users.

Cvars.name: banid
Cvars.help: Add a user ID to the ban list.

Cvars.name: sv_creationtickcheck
Cvars.help: Do extended check for encoding of timestamps against tickcount

Cvars.name: sv_max_queries_sec
Cvars.help: Maximum queries per second to respond to from a single IP address.

Cvars.name: sv_max_queries_window
Cvars.help: Window over which to average queries per second averages.

Cvars.name: sv_max_queries_tracked_ips_max
Cvars.help: Window over which to average queries per second averages.

Cvars.name: sv_max_queries_tracked_ips_prune
Cvars.help: Window over which to average queries per second averages.

Cvars.name: sv_max_queries_sec_global
Cvars.help: Maximum queries per second to respond to from anywhere.

Cvars.name: sv_logblocks
Cvars.help: If true when log when a query is blocked (can cause very large log files)

Cvars.name: sv_logsdir
Cvars.help: Folder in the game directory where server logs will be stored.

Cvars.name: sv_logfile
Cvars.help: Log server information in the log file.

Cvars.name: sv_logflush
Cvars.help: Flush the log file to disk on each write (slow).

Cvars.name: sv_logecho
Cvars.help: Echo log information to the console.

Cvars.name: sv_log_onefile
Cvars.help: Log server information to only one file.

Cvars.name: sv_logbans
Cvars.help: Log server bans in the server logs.

Cvars.name: sv_logsecret
Cvars.help: If set then include this secret when doing UDP logging (will use 0x53 as packet type, not usual 0x52)

Cvars.name: sv_logsocket
Cvars.help: Uses a specific outgoing socket for sv udp logging

Cvars.name: sv_logsocket2
Cvars.help: Uses a specific outgoing socket for second source of sv udp logging

Cvars.name: sv_logsocket2_substr
Cvars.help: Uses a substring match for second source of sv udp logging

Cvars.name: log
Cvars.help: Enables logging to file, console, and udp < on | off >.

Cvars.name: logaddress_add
Cvars.help: Set address and port for remote host <ip:port>.

Cvars.name: logaddress_add_ex
Cvars.help: Set address and port for remote host <ip:port> and supplies a unique token in the UDP packets.

Cvars.name: logaddress_token_secret
Cvars.help: Set a secret string that will be hashed when using logaddress with explicit token hash.

Cvars.name: logaddress_add_ts
Cvars.help: Set address and port for remote host <ip:port> and uses a unique checksum from logaddress_token_secret in the UDP packets.

Cvars.name: logaddress_delall
Cvars.help: Remove all udp addresses being logged to

Cvars.name: logaddress_del
Cvars.help: Remove address and port for remote host <ip:port>.

Cvars.name: logaddress_list
Cvars.help: List all addresses currently being used by logaddress.

Cvars.name: sv_hibernate_when_empty
Cvars.help: Puts the server into extremely low CPU usage mode when no clients connected

Cvars.name: sv_hibernate_punt_tv_clients
Cvars.help: When enabled will punt all GOTV clients during hibernation

Cvars.name: sv_hibernate_ms
Cvars.help: # of milliseconds to sleep per frame while hibernating

Cvars.name: sv_hibernate_ms_vgui
Cvars.help: # of milliseconds to sleep per frame while hibernating but running the vgui dedicated server frontend

Cvars.name: sv_hibernate_postgame_delay
Cvars.help: # of seconds to wait after final client leaves before hibernating.

Cvars.name: host_flush_threshold
Cvars.help: Memory threshold below which the host should flush caches between server instances

Cvars.name: sv_pausable_dev
Cvars.help: Whether listen server is pausable when running -dev and playing solo against bots

Cvars.name: sv_pausable_dev_ds
Cvars.help: Whether dedicated server is pausable when running -dev and playing solo against bots

Cvars.name: sv_pure
Cvars.help: Show user data.

Cvars.name: sv_pure_kick_clients
Cvars.help: If set to 1, the server will kick clients with mismatching files. Otherwise, it will issue a warning to the client.

Cvars.name: sv_pure_trace
Cvars.help: If set to 1, the server will print a message whenever a client is verifying a CRC for a file.

Cvars.name: sv_pure_consensus
Cvars.help: Minimum number of file hashes to agree to form a consensus.

Cvars.name: sv_pure_retiretime
Cvars.help: Seconds of server idle time to flush the sv_pure file hash cache.

Cvars.name: sv_cheats
Cvars.help: Allow cheats on server

Cvars.name: sv_lan
Cvars.help: Server is a lan server ( no heartbeat, no authentication, no non-class C addresses )

Cvars.name: sv_pausable
Cvars.help: Is the server pausable.

Cvars.name: sv_contact
Cvars.help: Contact email for server sysop

Cvars.name: sv_cacheencodedents
Cvars.help: If set to 1, does an optimization to prevent extra SendTable_Encode calls.

Cvars.name: sv_voicecodec
Cvars.help: Specifies which voice codec DLL to use in a game. Set to the name of the DLL without the extension.

Cvars.name: sv_downloadurl
Cvars.help: Location from which clients can download missing files

Cvars.name: sv_consistency
Cvars.help: Whether the server enforces file consistency for critical files

Cvars.name: sv_maxreplay
Cvars.help: Maximum replay time in seconds

Cvars.name: sv_mincmdrate
Cvars.help: This sets the minimum value for cl_cmdrate. 0 == unlimited.

Cvars.name: sv_maxcmdrate
Cvars.help: (If sv_mincmdrate is > 0), this sets the maximum value for cl_cmdrate.

Cvars.name: sv_client_cmdrate_difference
Cvars.help: cl_cmdrate is moved to within sv_client_cmdrate_difference units of cl_updaterate before it is clamped between sv_mincmdrate and sv_maxcmdrate.

Cvars.name: sv_client_min_interp_ratio
Cvars.help:
This can be used to limit the value of cl_interp_ratio for connected clients (only while they are connected).
              -1 = let clients set cl_interp_ratio to anything
 any other value = set minimum value for cl_interp_ratio

Cvars.name: sv_client_max_interp_ratio
Cvars.help: This can be used to limit the value of cl_interp_ratio for connected clients (only while they are connected). If sv_client_min_interp_ratio is -1, then this cvar has no effect.

Cvars.name: sv_client_predict
Cvars.help:
This can be used to force the value of cl_predict for connected clients (only while they are connected).
   -1 = let clients set cl_predict to anything
    0 = force cl_predict to 0
    1 = force cl_predict to 1

Cvars.name: tv_enable
Cvars.help: Activates GOTV on server (0=off;1=on;2=on when reserved)

Cvars.name: tv_enable1
Cvars.help: Activates GOTV[1] on server (0=off;1=on;2=on when reserved)

Cvars.name: user
Cvars.help: Show user data.

Cvars.name: users
Cvars.help: Show user info for players on server.

Cvars.name: maxplayers
Cvars.help: Change the maximum number of players allowed on this server.

Cvars.name: sv_shutdown
Cvars.help: Sets the server to shutdown when all games have completed

Cvars.name: sv_memlimit
Cvars.help: If set, whenever a game ends, if the total memory used by the server is greater than this # of megabytes, the server will exit.

Cvars.name: sv_minuptimelimit
Cvars.help: If set, whenever a game ends, if the server uptime is less than this number of hours, the server will continue running regardless of sv_memlimit.

Cvars.name: sv_maxuptimelimit
Cvars.help: If set, whenever a game ends, if the server uptime exceeds this number of hours, the server will exit.

Cvars.name: sv_send_stats
Cvars.help: show stats of running parallel send

Cvars.name: sv_parallel_send
Cvars.help: Pack and send snapshots in parallel for smoother server tick rate at the expense of spending more CPU.

Cvars.name: sv_search_key
Cvars.help: When searching for a dedicated server from lobby, restrict search to only dedicated servers having the same sv_search_key.

Cvars.name: heartbeat
Cvars.help: Force heartbeat of master servers

Cvars.name: sv_validate_edict_change_infos
Cvars.help: Verify that edict changeinfos are being calculated properly (used to debug local network backdoor mode).

Cvars.name: sv_enable_delta_packing
Cvars.help: When enabled, this allows for entity packing to use the property changes for building up the data. This is many times faster, but can be disabled for error checking.

Cvars.name: sv_debugmanualmode
Cvars.help: Make sure entities correctly report whether or not their network data has changed.

Cvars.name: tv_allow_camera_man_override
Cvars.help: Allows cameraman_override to have effect. When this is set, the primary interactive caster will have all the relevant fields present in all network packets, in every snapshot. This allows the secondary cameraman (-interactivecaster that connects to a tv port) to override those fields some seconds later regardless of whether they changed originally or not.

Cvars.name: sv_dump_class_info
Cvars.help: Dump server class infos.

Cvars.name: sv_dump_class_table
Cvars.help: Dump server class table matching the pattern (substr).

Cvars.name: plugin_print
Cvars.help: Prints details about loaded plugins

Cvars.name: plugin_pause
Cvars.help: plugin_pause <index> : pauses a loaded plugin

Cvars.name: plugin_unpause
Cvars.help: plugin_unpause <index> : unpauses a disabled plugin

Cvars.name: plugin_pause_all
Cvars.help: pauses all loaded plugins

Cvars.name: plugin_unpause_all
Cvars.help: unpauses all disabled plugins

Cvars.name: plugin_load
Cvars.help: plugin_load <filename> : loads a plugin

Cvars.name: plugin_unload
Cvars.help: plugin_unload <index> : unloads a plugin

Cvars.name: sv_forcepreload
Cvars.help: Force server side preloading.

Cvars.name: sv_precacheinfo
Cvars.help: Show precache info.

Cvars.name: rcon_password
Cvars.help: remote console password.

Cvars.name: sv_rcon_banpenalty
Cvars.help: Number of minutes to ban users who fail rcon authentication

Cvars.name: sv_rcon_maxfailures
Cvars.help: Max number of times a user can fail rcon authentication before being banned

Cvars.name: sv_rcon_minfailures
Cvars.help: Number of times a user can fail rcon authentication in sv_rcon_minfailuretime before being banned

Cvars.name: sv_rcon_minfailuretime
Cvars.help: Number of seconds to track failed rcon authentications

Cvars.name: sv_rcon_whitelist_address
Cvars.help: When set, rcon failed authentications will never ban this address, e.g. '127.0.0.1'

Cvars.name: sv_rcon_log
Cvars.help: Enable/disable rcon logging.

Cvars.name: stats
Cvars.help: Prints server performance variables

Cvars.name: sv_master_share_game_socket
Cvars.help: Use the game's socket to communicate to the master server. If this is 0, then it will create a socket on -steamport + 1 to communicate to the master server on.

Cvars.name: sv_steamauth_enforce
Cvars.help: By default, player must maintain a reliable connection to Steam servers. When player Steam session drops, enforce it: 2 = instantly kick, 1 = kick at next spawn, 0 = do not kick.

Cvars.name: sv_setsteamaccount
Cvars.help:
token
Set game server account token to use for logging in to a persistent game server account

Cvars.name: sv_show_usermessage
Cvars.help: Shows the user messages that the server is sending to clients. Setting this to 2 will show the contents of the message

Cvars.name: sv_region
Cvars.help: The region of the world to report this server in.

Cvars.name: sv_instancebaselines
Cvars.help: Enable instanced baselines. Saves network overhead.

Cvars.name: sv_stats
Cvars.help: Collect CPU usage stats

Cvars.name: sv_enableoldqueries
Cvars.help: Enable support for old style (HL1) server queries

Cvars.name: sv_reservation_tickrate_adjustment
Cvars.help: Adjust server tickrate upon reservation

Cvars.name: sv_password
Cvars.help: Server password for entry into multiplayer games

Cvars.name: sv_tags
Cvars.help: Server tags. Used to provide extra information to clients when they're browsing for servers. Separate tags with a comma.

Cvars.name: sv_visiblemaxplayers
Cvars.help: Overrides the max players reported to prospective clients

Cvars.name: sv_alternateticks
Cvars.help: If set, server only simulates entities on even numbered ticks.

Cvars.name: sv_allow_wait_command
Cvars.help: Allow or disallow the wait command on clients connected to this server.

Cvars.name: sv_reservation_timeout
Cvars.help: Time in seconds before lobby reservation expires.

Cvars.name: sv_reservation_grace
Cvars.help: Time in seconds given for a lobby reservation.

Cvars.name: sv_steamgroup
Cvars.help: The ID of the steam group that this server belongs to. You can find your group's ID on the admin profile page in the steam community.

Cvars.name: sv_steamgroup_exclusive
Cvars.help: If set, only members of Steam group will be able to join the server when it's empty, public people will be able to join the server only if it has players.

Cvars.name: sv_mmqueue_reservation

Cvars.name: sv_mmqueue_reservation_timeout
Cvars.help: Time in seconds before mmqueue reservation expires.

Cvars.name: sv_mmqueue_reservation_extended_timeout
Cvars.help: Extended time in seconds before mmqueue reservation expires.

Cvars.name: sv_debugtempentities
Cvars.help: Show temp entity bandwidth usage.

Cvars.name: sv_showtags
Cvars.help: Describe current gametags.

Cvars.name: blackbox_dump
Cvars.help: Dump the contents of the blackbox

Cvars.help: Frames to delay before taking snapshot

Cvars.name: bugreporter_username
Cvars.help: Username to use for bugreporter

Cvars.name: bugreporter_console_bytes

Cvars.name: _bugreporter_restart

Cvars.name: bug
Cvars.help: Show the bug reporting UI.

Cvars.name: debug_map_crc
Cvars.help: Prints CRC for each map lump loaded

Cvars.name: rate
Cvars.help: Max bytes/sec the host can receive data

Cvars.name: cl_cmdrate
Cvars.help: Max number of command packets sent to server per second

Cvars.name: cl_updaterate
Cvars.help: Number of packets per second of updates you are requesting from the server

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction
Cvars.help: Enable/disable clock correction on the client.

Cvars.name: cl_clockdrift_max_ms
Cvars.help: Maximum number of milliseconds the clock is allowed to drift before the client snaps its clock to the server's.

Cvars.name: cl_clockdrift_max_ms_threadmode
Cvars.help: Maximum number of milliseconds the clock is allowed to drift before the client snaps its clock to the server's.

Cvars.name: cl_clock_showdebuginfo
Cvars.help: Show debugging info about the clock drift.

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction_force_server_tick

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount
Cvars.help: Sets the maximum number of milliseconds per second it is allowed to correct the client clock. It will only correct this amount if the difference between the client and server clock is equal to or larger than cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset.

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset
Cvars.help: If the clock offset is less than this amount (in milliseconds), then no clock correction is applied.

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset
Cvars.help: As the clock offset goes from cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset to this value (in milliseconds), it moves towards applying cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount of adjustment. That way, the response is small when the offset is small.

Cvars.name: BindToggle

Cvars.name: echo
Cvars.help: Echo text to console.

Cvars.name: debug_drawbox
Cvars.help: Create debug box

Cvars.help: sets userinfo string for split screen player in slot 2

Cvars.name: cmd3
Cvars.help: sets userinfo string for split screen player in slot 3

Cvars.name: cmd4
Cvars.help: sets userinfo string for split screen player in slot 4

Cvars.name: findflags

Cvars.name: cvarlist
Cvars.help: Show the list of convars/concommands.

Cvars.name: help
Cvars.help: Find help about a convar/concommand.

Cvars.name: differences

Cvars.help: Reset a bunch of game convars to default values

Cvars.name: fs_report_sync_opens
Cvars.help: 0:Off, 1:Always, 2:Not during map load

Cvars.name: fs_report_sync_opens_callstack
Cvars.help: 0 to not display the call-stack when we hit a fs_report_sync_opens warning. Set to 1 to display the call-stack.

Cvars.name: fs_report_long_reads
Cvars.help: 0:Off, 1:All (for tracking accumulated duplicate read times), >1:Microsecond threshold

Cvars.name: fs_warning_mode
Cvars.help: 0:Off, 1:Warn main thread, 2:Warn other threads

Cvars.name: fs_monitor_read_from_pack
Cvars.help: 0:Off, 1:Any, 2:Sync only

Cvars.name: fs_allow_unsafe_writes
Cvars.help: 0: Disallow writes to filesystem locations we don't own. 1: Allow such writes (potentially unsafe).

Cvars.name: filesystem_buffer_size
Cvars.help: Size of per file buffers. 0 for none

Cvars.name: fs_dump_open_duplicate_times
Cvars.help: Set fs_report_long_reads 1 before loading to use this. Prints a list of files that were opened more than once and ~how long was spent reading from them.

Cvars.name: fs_clear_open_duplicate_times
Cvars.help: Clear the list of files that have been opened.

Cvars.name: fs_fios_flush_cache
Cvars.help: Flushes the FIOS HDD cache.

Cvars.name: fs_fios_print_prefetches
Cvars.help: Displays all the prefetches currently in progress.

Cvars.name: fs_fios_prefetch_file
Cvars.help:
Prefetches a file: </PS3_GAME/USRDIR/filename.bin>.
The preftech is medium priority and persistent.

Cvars.name: fs_fios_prefetch_file_in_pack
Cvars.help:
Prefetches a file in a pack: <portal2/models/container_ride/fineDebris_part5.ani>.
The preftech is medium priority and non-persistent.

Cvars.name: fs_fios_cancel_prefetches
Cvars.help: Cancels all the prefetches in progress.

Cvars.name: async_mode
Cvars.help: Set the async filesystem mode (0 = async, 1 = synchronous)

Cvars.name: async_simulate_delay
Cvars.help: Simulate a delay of up to a set msec per file operation

Cvars.name: async_allow_held_files
Cvars.help: Allow AsyncBegin/EndRead()

Cvars.name: filesystem_native
Cvars.help: Use native FS or STDIO

Cvars.name: loader_spew_info
Cvars.help: 0:Off, 1:Timing, 2:Completions, 3:Late Completions, 4:Creations/Purges, -1:All

Cvars.name: find
Cvars.help: Find concommands with the specified string in their name/help text.
